2017-07-11.caption: From acai to chicory, elements of the Amazon make this #MySuperG. Immerse yourself in the rainforest on #GoogleEarth at g.co/IAmAmazon. #IAmAmazon

#ShowUp Stories: “I’ve been through a lot in my life and I could be brought down by it, or I could use that fear, that sadness, and make it something good. Showing up is being there for people who, even though you may never meet them, they see you and they see you as an example. And Pride to me is just that—being yourself and just celebrating you as a person.”—Vertel, San Francisco, CA. How will you #ShowUp? pride.google.com

2017-07-13.caption: #teampixel profiles: this week we’re featuring #pixelperfect and noted professional fine art photographer @graymalin, whose sunny photos give an escape to dreamy landscapes. His advice on capturing great shots: “Once you see a moment you want to capture, try placing something familiar in it like your hand holding a cocktail, or a pair of sunglasses - it makes it more relatable."

2017-07-14.caption: Have a favorite small business? Share the ️♥️ with a heart-shaped photo and tag with #SmallThanks. We'll be giving them some big thanks this summer—stay tuned.
When in doubt, talk it out. Trusted adults are essential to helping kids #BeInternetAwesome. We’ve got new resources for parents and educators at g.co/BeInternetAwesome.

2017-07-16.caption:
It's Sundae Funday! Share a heart-shaped photo from your favorite ice cream shop and tag #SmallThanks to celebrate #NationalIceCreamDay 🍦

Special thanks to our treat-on-the-street correspondents for the photos: @icecream.direct, @bcandy_oc, @bailey.ellyne, @rojiecheekz, @colettagelato, @girl_racer, @foodiswhyimbroke and @JJLeeDesign.
For that friend who's late to the watch party. #GoogleAssistant #GoTS7

2017-07-18.caption: With larger than average paws and a winning smile—it must be Kuzco! When not basking in the sun, this Mountain View-based #Doogler enjoys chasing birds, eating napkins and sleeping in uncomfortable positions.

#ShowUp Stories: “I show up because I love my son. And even if my son wasn’t gay, I’d still be on the side of human rights. Try to imagine this...50 years ago, interracial marriages were unacceptable. I am half Filipino, half Japanese—it was unacceptable. I think because I went through a little bit of...feeling I was not quite good enough, it made me have to stop and think. We all need to be accepted. It’s a big deal...to me it’s a big deal.”—Jeff, Hilo, HI. How will you #ShowUp? pride.google.com

2017-07-20.caption: Airport or museum? @suluhpandu captures the colorful side of travel with this #pixelperfect tunnel at Raden Inten II Airport, Indonesia.

2017-06-27.caption: This blue-eyed beauty is Kaya, a Los Angeles-based #Doogler who has an impressive dog toy collection and loves prancing around Venice Beach.

#ShowUp Stories: “I show up because black voices need to be heard. Black trans women need to be seen. We need to be featured. We need to be visible. And most of all, we need a platform.” —Daroneshia, Birmingham, AL. How will you #ShowUp for Pride? Find your parade at pride.google.com.

2017-06-28.caption: Let’s goat down to business. Namaste, #GoogleAssistant.

2017-06-29.caption: A #pixelperfect ray of architectural sunshine from @lamdotdot.

#ShowUp Stories: “We think of parades as superficial, but they are protests. Pride is about stepping into discomfort and showing up for people who need it. I am LatinX, mentally ill, and non-binary, but I still have to listen. I show up for intersectionality. Because Black Lives Matter. I show up because there are people who can’t—I used to be one of those people.”—Jash, Wichita, KS. How will you #ShowUp? pride.google.com

2017-07-03.caption: Wool you just look at this amazing #MySuperG from @ahmaddoosti1?

2017-07-04.caption: The #Doogler will see you now. Say hello to Kobe, an LA-based pup who, when not conducting important meetings, enjoys watching basketball and eating blueberries.

2017-07-06.caption: This #pixelperfect snapshot of Mumbai by @charoorathi gives a window into life in the vibrant city.

#ShowUp Stories: “If you don’t speak out, you’re not making the movement grow. If you rally and speak and demonstrate, there’s a possibility of change. I show up because if I can change the mind of one person, that would be worth it. And if I can change the mind of many, that’s even better.”—Frances, New York, NY. How will you #ShowUp? pride.google.com

2017-06-06.caption: A new chapter in our book: #BeInternetAwesome, a new way to help kids learn how to be smart, confident explorers of the online world. Flip through lesson plans, parent resources and a new game at g.co/BeInternetAwesome.
One ice cream sandwich coming right pup! Meet Vitas, a San Francisco-based #Doogler whose favorite things to chase include bubbles, tennis balls and his tail.

2017-06-07.caption: Meet the Internauts. They know a little something about how to #BeInternetAwesome. Find them in Interland, a new game that teaches kids about digital safety. Adventure awaits at g.co/Interland.

2017-06-08.caption: #teampixel profiles: this week we’re featuring #pixelperfect photographer @daveast, whose photos capture striking perspectives from city centers to remote mountains. On taking great shots he says, “It’s all about the moment and light. Waiting for the right time and having patience to do so, then lining everything up to how you like it.”

2017-06-09.caption: New to #StreetView: Australia’s iconic Uluru. See the iconic landmark and experience its stories through the voices of the Anangu people, who have lived there for more than 30,000 years.

2017-06-13.caption: Summertime, and the livin’ is easy—especially for Kacee, a Mountain View-based #Doogler. Aside from her dazzling smile, this corgi is also a herding pro among Bay Area sheep.
The internet can be a megaphone for oversharers. Head over to Interland, a new game that teaches kids to share with care and #BeInternetAwesome. g.co/Interland

2017-06-15.caption: This week we’re featuring #teampixel photographer, @_richardhall. As a journalist, Richard uses his Pixel to capture stories from his travels through the Middle East, from the Syrian civil war to the refugee crisis. On taking photos with Pixel for work he says, “I used to lug around a big camera with me on stories, but it got in the way [...] Setting up a camera to take a shot can interrupt all that; it puts up a barrier between me and the subject. My aim is always to take the best shot with as little fuss as possible—to keep that conversation going.”

2017-06-19.caption: Details for days in this intricate #MySuperG drawing by @laraibafroz.

2017-06-20.caption: Hailing from our Washington, D.C. office, it’s Finn (aka Finnikins)! Just a pup, this #Doogler is new to the office, but is already making his mark by sleeping under his dad’s desk and impressing onlookers with his leaf-chasing abilities.

2017-06-21.caption: This #Pride2017, Corpus Christi showed up for their first-ever parade. LA showed up to resist. And Birmingham showed up to light up the night. How will you #ShowUp? pride.google

2017-06-22.caption: Waiting for our turn on this #pixelperfect swing with a view from @randomitguylv.

2017-05-22.caption: We’re stepping into the week in style with this #MySuperG from @tom.lowe. Tag your own creative interpretation of our logo for a chance to be featured.

2017-05-23.caption: Greetings from Teddy, a (royal) NYC-based #Doogler. While he has impeccable manners most of the time, he’s never met a toy he couldn’t destroy. 👑

2017-05-24.caption: #GrowWithGoogle Small Biz Stories, Vol. 10: “With the web, we’ve been able to expose our products to people who have never seen them before,” says Lundy Wilder, founder of @villalagoontile. Lundy launched their first website in 2008 and began offering custom cement tiles like the bold, ornate designs she’d seen from Cuba and Spain. Thanks to Google search and advertising, Villa Lagoon Tile can compete against big-box stores for cement tiles. “Now we’re getting calls from customers everywhere under the sun.”

2017-05-25.caption: #teampixel profiles: this week we’re featuring #pixelperfect photographer @crissibeth, who creatively captures the magic of her native New York City. Her advice for taking great photos: “Take your time lining up a shot and focusing. Make sure you have good light. And practice a lot!”

2017-05-26.caption: #teampixel comes to life at the Meadow, an immersive exhibit displaying hundreds of pictures from Pixel photographers around the world. Created in partnership with @refinery29, the event is open (and free!) until June 4th at the High Line in NYC.

2017-05-29.caption: This crafty #MySuperG made of pasta by @mahshad.shohrati is simply too cute to eat.

2017-05-30.caption: This poised pup is Dodger, a NYC-based #Doogler whose favorite things include riding on trains and elevators. Such a city boy.
Happy 10th birthday, #StreetView 🎉! Seven continents, 83 countries, millions of miles, one epic road (and bike and boat and climbing!) trip. Swipe through for some of the best of Street View.

2017-05-31.caption: 1.2B memories uploaded every day and 500M friends—that's a lot of cake to share. Happy 2nd birthday, Google Photos! 🎂

2017-06-01.caption: Quaint details and bold colors make this shot by @rreginatorr #pixelperfect.

2017-06-03.caption: Code is the new cape. We’re proud to support the #MadewithCode teen girls who make coding one of their superpowers. What’s yours?

2017-06-05.caption: Grab a brush, we're having a paint party with with this #MySuperG from @sohamduttacreations. Tag your own creative interpretation of our logo for a chance to be featured.

2017-05-12.caption: #GrowWithGoogle Small Biz Stories, Vol. 8: “Whether you’re a kid making bread for the first time or an expert struggling with a new technique, we want to help you have the best experience possible,” says Bill Tine, VP of Marketing at @kingarthurflour, a 227 year-old flour company. Their website has evolved into an e-commerce store as well as a popular baking recipe destination. Google Analytics provides them with the data to better understand and meet the needs of their customers. “That’s what we strive for. To have a meaningful impact on our bakers, and to save the world, one recipe at a time.”

2017-05-15.caption: This #MySuperG from @its.arman and @v.izadi is in full bloom. 🌼 Tag your own creative interpretation and we'll share our favorites!

#GrowWithGoogle Small Biz Stories, Vol. 9: “When people struggle with hair loss, it’s not a funny thing, but I try to bring fun to it, make it more commonly talked about instead of something to be ashamed of,” says Jesseca Dupart, owner and CEO of a New Orleans-based salon that sells a full hair care line @kaleidoscopehairproducts that restores hair follicles and works on any hair type. Kaleidoscope uses digital marketing tools like AdWords, Google’s advertising program, and Google Shopping campaigns to advertise on Google Search and YouTube. “Within six months, I was selling overseas, and I’ve never been overseas. With the Internet and Google tools, you can now touch so many more people.”

2017-05-16.caption: Perfectly perched on this bench is Bixby, a San Francisco-based #Doogler named after the Bixby Creek Bridge in Big Sur. While he will eat truly anything, the way to his heart (stomach) is with a ripe 🍊.
Your I/O seat awaits. Follow along tomorrow as @sundarpichai kicks off what's stirring at Google #io17. For more on I/O, visit the link in our bio.

2017-05-17.caption: Sun's out, fun's out for our annual developer conference. Time for #io17 ☀️

2017-05-18.caption: Code-based art by @ezzzrrra takes flight at #io17's Museum of Developer Art.

#teampixel profiles: this week we’re featuring #pixelperfect photographer @audiphotography, whose unique photos capture moments through his travels around the world. “I think the idea of making a great image is all about the story you want to tell."
Attendees explore demos of our latest (and most fun) technology in #io17 Sandboxes. One of our favorites is this A.I. Experiment that uses object recognition to make song lyrics.

2017-05-19.caption: Can't stop, won't stop. Our last day of #io17 is in full swing.

2017-05-02.caption: #GrowWithGoogle Small Biz Stories, Vol. 2: “We see a lot more customer reviews and feedback, and the impact our gifts have on people,” says Rich, co-owner of @artificerwoodworks. “That motivates us to keep coming up with new ideas and new products.” As a small business that provides artisan, personalized wooden wine boxes as unique wedding gifts, co-owners Rich Norton and Marc Stitzlein agree that monitoring online feedback through Google reviews, and then adjusting to meet customer demand, is the most rewarding part of their business.
We’re all smiles for Remington (Remi, for short), a San Francisco-based #Doogler who enjoys splashing around in the Bay and trying to convince his Googler owner that he’s not too big to be a lap dog.

2017-05-03.caption: #GrowWithGoogle Small Biz Stories, Vol. 3: “Our philosophy is that magical moments and innovation come from accidents,” explains Lucas Sin, culinary chef of @junzikitchen. “Then you refine things, keep testing, keep developing. We allow ourselves to make mistakes every day.” The team uses Google docs to collaborate, jotting down ideas whenever inspiration hits, and then brings that collaboration to life together in their kitchen.

2017-05-04.caption: Take a walk down this #pixelperfect path of architectural infinity in Dubai with this shot by @thisisrahil.
The Force is strong with Pegman. #MayThe4thBeWithYou

#GrowWithGoogle Small Biz Stories, Vol. 4: “You have to take a leap of faith,” says Taryn Rodighiero, founder of @kaikinibikinis. That’s how she felt when she decided to start her own line of swimwear, investing her life savings in five commercial sewing machines. Taryn reaches most of her customers, whether on neighboring Hawaiian islands or far-off Australia, through the internet, with roughly 80 percent of her sales happening on the KaiKini website. Google Analytics is her “go to whenever I really want to know for sure where my sources are coming from and who's buying what.” #SmallBusinessWeek

2017-05-05.caption: #GrowWithGoogle Small Biz Stories, Vol. 5: “Every customer story I hear delights me to no end,” says Tristan Walker, CEO of @bevel. “That’s why we do this in the first place, right?” With the first-ever shaving system for men with coarse and curly hair, Bevel is a small business focused on giving black men smoother skin. “Google makes it incredibly easy to start a program and scale quickly,” Tristan remarks. They use YouTube videos to build awareness and share customer stories. “It’s a powerful way to introduce new people to the company.” #SmallBusinessWeek

2017-05-08.caption: #GrowWithGoogle Small Biz Stories, Vol. 6: “Everything we do is for dogs. And not just because we love them so much, but because they love us,” says Carol Perkins, the dog lover behind @harrybarker_co, creator of beautiful, functional, eco-friendly dog products. Today, Harry Barker wholesales their high-end, eco-friendly products to over 1,300 stores across the U.S. and 17 other countries. “Google tools allow us to get in front of customers who otherwise wouldn’t discover us.”

2017-05-09.caption: Lights, camera, 🌶! Pepper is a San Francisco-based #Doogler who is often found helping her videographer dad out behind the camera. Ways to her heart: apples, peanut butter and high fives.

2017-05-10.caption: #GrowWithGoogle Small Biz Stories, Vol. 7: “I spoke with everyone who booked a trip for this week, and every single one of them told me they heard about us through Google,” remarks Kari Rowley, General Manager of @majestic_heli. Founded by Njord Rota, a lifelong skier and helicopter pilot, Majestic Heli Ski offers an amazing experience: the chance to live and ski in the pristine mountains of Alaska. They rely on Google advertising to get the word out and maximize business during the few months of operation that they have. “AdWords is a critical tool for us to reach new customers who are researching a purchasing decision.”

2017-05-11.caption: And just when these Googlers started to feel two-tired, they pulled through for #BikeToWorkDay. 🚲
Low light and crowd-pleasing tunes. Thanks @wussupyz for capturing these #pixelperfect purple hues.

2017-04-20.caption: The world looks good through purple-and-pink-colored glasses. Thanks @holgerhespelein for capturing this #pixelperfect piece of the rainbow.
E-A-R-T-H—just another way to spell H-O-M-E. @nasa_eo captured every letter of the alphabet in nature for the new #GoogleEarth. g.co/earth

2017-04-21.caption: “This is where I belong.” Discover @janegoodallinst’s world and meet her friends (including a young chimpanzee named Google) on the new #GoogleEarth. g.co/earth

2017-04-22.caption: The way we live, from a new perspective. Discover what “home” means to people all over the world on the new #GoogleEarth. #EarthDay2017 g.co/earth

2017-04-24.caption: Everything is awesome in this #MySuperG by @bettypatranias.

2017-04-25.caption: Say hi to Skippy, a Mountain View-based #Doogler named after his favorite peanut butter. On a typical day you’ll find him hanging on campus with his T. rex pal, Stan, and running around in circles.

2017-04-26.caption: #HistoryIsHappening on Google Expeditions. Today the #HamiltonSF cast explored Hamilton history on Cardboard, as part of Google.org's support of #EduHam to bring Alexander Hamilton's story to life for students online and onstage.

2017-04-27.caption: When concrete and colors come together to make architectural magic. Thanks @ammar_7191 for this #pixelperfect perspective.
Paint from a new perspective with virtual reality. With the latest #tiltbrush update, you can can share your sketches, explore others and remix shared artwork. 🖌️tiltbrush.com/sketches

2017-05-01.caption: This week’s #MySuperG from @maroshina has everything but the kitchen sink.

As part of our commitment to help businesses thrive, we’re celebrating #SmallBusinessWeek by sharing stories of people who #GrowWithGoogle. Small Biz Stories, Vol 1: “The Internet makes our customers feel like they’re part of our community, even when they’re often thousands of miles away,” says Kelley Hobart, co-owner of @alpacadirect. Kelley credits the growth of her family business to Google AdWords and Analytics, which helps them find niche markets interested in durable, eco-friendly yarn and fiber. “There are a lot of people all over the world who don’t have a local yarn shop. We want to become their local yarn shop even though we’re all the way here in Idaho. With Google tools, we can do that, and they can be part of our community.”

2017-04-06.caption: Now that's a sunrise we'd wake up early for. Thanks @mitchelloates for capturing this #pixelperfect coastal scene in Sydney.

2017-04-10.caption: The Monday struggle is real—even for a #Doogler. Good thing Chewy has his favorite snack (baby carrots) to look forward to at the office.
Pixels + petals = a match made in flower heaven. See how the two came together for an evening of 🏵️ arranging and photography in NYC in our story. #teampixel

2017-04-11.caption: Something about this #MySuperG is really drawing us in. Doodle, sketch and create in no time with AutoDraw, a new #MachineLearning tool to help you draw fast. ✍️ autodraw.com

2017-04-13.caption: #teampixel profiles: this week we’re featuring #pixelperfect photographer @theworldwalk, who captures his adventurous travels across the globe with his furry sidekick, Savannah. On his favorite photography subjects, he says, “Savannah, my dog, ranks an easy number one. My phone is filled with photos of her doing nothing. After Savannah it’s anything unique I run into while walking. Since I’m on the move all day I don’t have the ability to plan out photos. I just keep walking and hope I encounter something interesting. Most days I do.”

2017-04-17.caption: Swatch out, this colorful #MySuperG by @tom.lowe is coming for your paintbrush.
It’s #NationalParkWeek and the wondrous outdoors is calling. From lava tubes in Hawaii to icebergs in Alaska, explore the hidden worlds of national parks in our story. #FindYourPark

2017-04-18.caption: Discover the entire world from a new perspective. This is the new #GoogleEarth. g.co/earth
Meet Freddy, a fluffy Los Angeles-based #Doogler with a passion for travel (has visited 20 U.S. states!) and a mild obsession with chickens.
What, you thought humans were the only ones with moves? Check out the @bbcearth experience on the new #GoogleEarth. g.co/earth

2017-04-19.caption: Say hello, kedu, salaam, namaste and hola to the girls of @sesamestreet around the world on the new #GoogleEarth. g.co/earth

2017-03-27.caption: We've got a sweet tooth for this week's #MySuperG from @filmgarden. 🍬

"Be brave. Be empowered. Be yourself." From a role in government to partnering with Google, former U.S. Treasurer Rosie Rios has worked to inspire and empower young women. After leading the effort to ensure a woman would appear on U.S. currency for the first time, Rios is now focused on her Teachers Righting History initiative which gives teachers and students access to the database so that they can recognize the contributions that women have made to American history. Rios also recently partnered with Google to create 40 new Expeditions to give children the ability to experience different professions in virtual reality as "our future leaders need inspiration in order to have aspiration." #WomensHistoryMonth

2017-03-28.caption: Go to our Kansas City, Missouri office and you'll be greeted by #Doogler Tripp's gigantic smile. When not showing off those pearly whites, Tripp is known to play fetch for hours on end.

2017-03-30.caption: Meet Laura, our head of Latino engagement. "Women at Google are fierce! We are leaders who are redefining the face of tech. I am especially proud to be a Latina at Google because our life journey has often called for a little more grit and a lot of resilience. Many of us were the first to attend college or to move away from home. I am one of the few Latinas, maybe the only one, with a dual MBA/MPA from Harvard. In 2005, I was the only Latino serving as a Congressional Legislative Director for a period of time. It can be hard to be the only one and to have the courage to speak your truth. The Latinas here at Google have their own remarkable stories. The result is an incredible group of Latinas who persevere and advance our community's economic and social well-being. I couldn't imagine being on this path with anyone else!" #WomensHistoryMonth
#teampixel profiles: this week we're featuring #pixelperfect photographer @davidswailes, whose dreamy shots capture everything from fields of flowers to English architecture.

2017-03-31.caption: The #Google4Doodle judges are done noodling, and now it is time for the art to shine. Congratulations to Sarah Harrison of Connecticut, whose vision of “a peaceful future” won this year's contest!

Meet Sapna, a Senior Analytical Lead in our Mumbai office and avid traveler (she's one country away from reaching her goal of visiting 30 countries before age 30!). "I'm proud to be a woman at Google because of the amazing people I work with every day. I've worked at Google for five years, and I have learned something from every single Googler I've met." #WomensHistoryMonth
This year's #Doodle4Google contest brought oodles of inspiring Doodles! See how our finalists envision the future. To see more amazing artwork, tap the link in our bio.

2017-04-01.caption: Introducing #GoogleGnome—hands free help for the backyard is now just an "Ok Gnome" away. The smart yard you always wanted is finally here.

2017-04-03.caption: #MySuperG is ready to fly! Thanks @poliedric_com for this light and feathery creation.

2017-04-04.caption: Say hello to Graycie, a bundle of #Doogler joy at our HQ in Mountain View. When not chasing her tail, she loves savoring every last treat and playing on the beach.
From the club floor to virtual reality: our collaboration with @boilerroomtv and @fjaak brings Berlin's underground club culture to Daydream with #VRDancefloors.

2017-03-14.caption: When it's #PiDay *and* @alberteinstein's birthday, you serve a slice of relativity.

Meet Nishma, the head of Ads Marketing for the U.K. and Ireland. “I want to radically change the way women are represented in our world—in film, media and advertising—so that little girls (and boys) realise there is no such thing as 'girls’ jobs' or 'boys’ jobs.'" #WomensHistoryMonth
Say hello to Bruce Springsteen the #Doogler, a rescue from Puerto Rico. He now enjoys his days as "The Boss" of our NYC office.

2017-03-15.caption: To bring the inside magic of our data centers to the outside walls, our #DataCenterMurals project partners with local artists to reimagine our spaces. Peeking through the trees on our center in Dublin is an illustration of the city's Phoenix Park, created by local artist @fuchsiamacaree.

2017-03-16.caption: This photo is so pretty we can't help but flock to it. Thanks @mohamedjameer for catching these birds at the #pixelperfect moment.

Meet Monique, a software engineer at our Belo Horizonte, Brazil office. "As a senior female engineer, I'm proud to be a woman in a male-dominated industry. I’m also proud to be the Latin America regional tech lead for Women@Google, an internal community that empowers female Googlers with professional development and networking. I've been a Googler for more than 10 years (55 percent of its existence as a company!), and I’ve felt supported to pursue my professional and personal goals throughout all of those years." #WomensHistoryMonth

2017-03-21.caption: Today, Google.org announced its two-year, $50 million commitment to support innovative nonprofits that use technology to close the global education gap. One of these organizations is @PBStoryweaver, which uses an open-sourced platform to translate books for students around the world, like these students in Bengaluru, India.

2017-03-22.caption: This beachy #MySuperG by @ms.monis is pointing us straight to the water. To that we say, "shell yes."

Olá de São Paulo! Today we hosted #GoogleForBrasil, an event to showcase our commitment to the country and how we're building a more inclusive internet for everyone, everywhere. With a breathtaking view in a theater designed by Brazilian architect Oscar Niemeyer, we announced audio-only calls in Duo, low-res backup in Photos, location sharing in Maps and a $5M investment in education. 📷: @cesinha

2017-03-23.caption: We’ve found the cutest flower to ever bloom. Thanks @aircooledcafe for capturing this shot of your #pixelperfect pup. #nationalpuppyday

Meet Kawana, a lawyer in our New York office, who says she's inspired by strong women in her life both at home and at work. On what she hopes to accomplish on behalf of women everywhere, “I’ll pay it forward. I’ve been lucky to have powerful and positive female influences in my life (hi Mom!). By exhibiting character, confidence, and a strong work ethic, I hope to be a force for good in another young girl’s life." #WomensHistoryMonth

2017-02-28.caption: Meet Kourtni, a Google engineer and global co-chair of our Black Googler Network. “While working in the music industry as an audio engineer, I started thinking about interesting ways in which computer science could be used to improve music making processes. At some point I realized that if I ever wanted to see those innovations, I might have to be the one to create them; so I went back to school to get my computer science degrees.” #BlackHistoryMonth

2017-03-01.caption: More than 10 million Cardboard viewers have shipped worldwide—and not just to humans! Meet Emmy, a Mountain View-based #Doogler whose hobbies include exploring virtual reality and avoiding bath time.

2017-03-02.caption: Talk about a #pixelperfect spread. Thanks to @chandanbhola for capturing this colorful scene in Delhi.

2017-03-03.caption: Throughout #WomensHistoryMonth, we'll be sharing profiles of women at Google who break down barriers and make a difference in their communities. To kick things off, meet Alexandrina, a customer engineer. "I am building a tribe of women who question gender roles, are curious to explore their purpose and what they can offer their community, and have causes that they are passionate about (two of mine are education and how food affects health and disease). I have found this tribe at Google, a company that is full of innovative and self-aware women, and I feel very proud to be surrounded by these women who inspire me."

2017-03-06.caption: This week, the G is for graffiti with this street art #MySuperG by @mancinism.

2017-03-07.caption: Say hello to Suka Evangeline Shywalker, a friendly #Doogler from our Sunnyvale office. When she's not giving high fives, you can catch her doing yoga stretches on the lawn.

Meet Tea, a creative director at our Sydney office. "I'm proud because Google is proud of its women. Our commitment to equality and diversity has been persistent and committed. Most of all I feel proud to be a woman at Google because of the respect and understanding I've received since I came out as transgender, and during my transition." #WomensHistoryMonth 📷: @cphillips77

2017-03-08.caption: Today's #GoogleDoodle celebrates global historical heroines who inspire us all to create a more inclusive, gender equal world. Explore how they've changed the world at google.com. #IWD2017

2017-03-09.caption: Thanks @pedromiguelferreira for capturing this #pixelperfect scene fit for a royal Spanish palace. When can we move in?

Meet Jen Holland, a program manager on our education team who works on products like Google Classroom and Expeditions (a virtual field trip app for schools). "The biggest joy I get is going into a class and seeing the magic of Expeditions take over. The students are totally engaged without even realizing it and are so immersed in these tours and asking incredible inquisitive questions. The teachers can hardly believe what they are seeing and the smiles on their faces is just priceless. That's what learning should look like every day." #WomensHistoryMonth

2017-03-13.caption: When art, friends, and endless color collide: to celebrate the joyous festival of #Holi, artist @hanifkureshi gathered a group of friends to cover the streets of New Delhi with color. He says, "It's more of a playground than an artwork where people can come, play and be part of it. And by default, become part of the art work."

2017-02-14.caption: 🎶Ella is for the way you look at me...🎶 Say hi to Ella, a #Doogler from our New York City office. When she's not snuggled up with her owner, she is with her one true love: her ball.

2017-02-15.caption: Meet Bertrand, a product manager and member of the Black Googler Network. Through his work, he always keeps diversity and inclusivity top of mind: "It never ceases to amaze me how much enthusiasm there is in various regions when we launch in different languages. People are so excited to be included in different products." #BlackHistoryMonth

2017-02-16.caption: @theweloveyouproject is a photo series with a mission to photograph over 1,000 Black men and boys across the US. Photographer Bryon Summers stopped by our HQ to take photos of Black Googlers and their families as part of the project's partnership with @googleartsculture. #BlackHistoryMonth
Who knew snowfall could be so colorful? @tylerkochanski captured this #pixelperfect urban rainbow among the flurries in NYC.

2017-02-20.caption: Feeling Zen with this succulent #MySuperG from @roslynka_anna.

2017-02-21.caption: Meet Olive, a Mountain View #Doogler who fancies monochromatic lounge areas. No matter where or when, she's always up for a game of fetch and a good smooch. 💋

2017-02-22.caption: Meet Kevin, a user experience engineer for YouTube who also oversees the intranet presence for the Black Googler Network. Kevin says overcoming obstacles such as homelessness has helped him in his role to "emphasize empathy and thorough, outside-in thinking." And of the people who supported him along the way, he says they inspired him to know that "it doesn't matter where I started, but where I finish." #BlackHistoryMonth

2017-02-23.caption: If you need us today, we'll be hanging out in this sunny, #pixelperfect shot from @krisxdee. ☀️

2017-02-24.caption: Congrats to the #Doodle4Google state and territory finalists! Vote for your favorite before 5 p.m. ET on March 6 to help decide which young artist's submission will be featured on the Google homepage → g.co/go/d4g2017

2017-02-26.caption: You might not be nominated tonight, but the award for best picture will always belong to you. Keep all your photos and videos safe with the Google Photos app on Android and iPhone. #googlephotos

2017-02-27.caption: We like this dotty #MySuperG a lot-y. Thanks, @aha.land!

2017-01-24.caption: This playful #Doogler goes by the name of Ozzie. A resident of our Kirkland, WA office, Ozzie enjoys snacking on his owner's socks (that's when that cute smile comes in handy). 😊
Last week's theme was all about animals. Thanks @ceklund05 for changing things up with this colorful, #pixelperfect chameleon.

2017-01-26.caption: Sometimes the blues aren't so bad. For this week's #teampixel theme, we want to see how you capture the color blue. Be sure to tag your photos with #teampixel for a chance to be featured here next Tuesday. Thanks @raenbowww for sharing this #pixelperfect world of neon.

2017-01-28.caption: Flocking together to welcome the year of the rooster. Happy #LunarNewYear!

2017-02-01.caption: Throughout #BlackHistoryMonth, we'll be sharing profiles of Black Googlers and how they support the Black community both inside and outside of Google. Today, meet Tia. Not only is she leading efforts to create a more web-connected community in Raleigh and Durham, NC, but in her 20% time she is co-leading Google's #BlackHistoryMonth programming spanning 70+ events across US Google offices. Says Tia, "It's more than just Black history, it's a collective history of Americans. Let's all learn and celebrate."

2017-02-06.caption: All buttoned up and ready to take on the week with this #MySuperG from @anuroopclicks.

2017-02-07.caption: Goodbye Westeros, hello Greenland. Wearing a trusty Street View Trekker backpack, @nikolajwilliamcw helped capture the country's changing landscape for Google Maps. Check out his adventure in our story.
Say hello to Stella, a sleepy #Doogler from our Mountain View office. A consistently late riser, she's not the most punctual pooch. 😴

2017-02-08.caption: Meet Lynette. Lynette is a global co-chair of the Black Googler Network, which strives to foster success in the Black community at Google and beyond. In her day-to-day role, she leads a team dedicated to finding top talent for Google: "I utilize my background to encourage my team to read between the lines, consider different angles, and lean in on a candidate's past impact to find them the right role at Google." #BlackHistoryMonth
So many questions, so much VR. We're going behind the scenes of virtual reality at Google with #NatAndLo—what do you want to know? 🤔

2017-02-09.caption: Is this real life? Because this #pixelperfect adventure into the blue caves of Iceland by @hotforsagan looks like a dream.

2017-02-11.caption: Shining bright at #LanternFestival as we mark the end of #LunarNewYear celebrations.

2017-01-05.caption: We want to see (and share!) your #pixelperfect photos. Each week we'll choose a new theme for you to capture with your Pixel. We're kicking off 2017 with a trip outdoors, like this beauty of Arches National Park from @therealblasiansensation. What are you seeing outside? Take a shot using your Pixel and tag #teampixel for a chance to be featured next week. Now get out there!

This pug is a jet-setter. Meet Jade, a travel-loving #Doogler from our Seattle office who loves to join her human on trips to different Google offices.

👏 when your favorite 90's dance move comes back in style. The Running Man was searched more in 2016 than ever before. #YearInSearch #RunningManChallenge
Ugly vegetables? We don't carrot all. By using produce that wasn't considered pretty enough to sell, we helped our Bay Area cafés save over one million pounds of food waste in 2016. g.co/environment

2016-12-09.caption: Over 10 years ago, Google engineer Rebecca Moore used Google Earth to prevent the logging of 1,000 acres of redwood trees near her home in the Santa Cruz, CA mountains. Her project ultimately inspired the creation of Google Earth Engine, a satellite imagery platform which helps monitor global deforestation. → g.co/environment

Meet Charleton, a well-dressed #Doogler from our New York City office. He loves the goodies at Chelsea Market — which he eats with his charming underbite.

2016-11-02.caption: Celebrating the Day of the Dead among a bed of marigolds. #VivoDiaDeMuertos
#Code comes to life in unexpected ways. @MadewithCode joined the fun at the Grace Hopper Celebration of Women in Computing last month. #GHC16

2016-10-07.caption: Meet Alberto, a member of HOLA, our Hispanic Googlers Network. Alberto is a finance engineer, former DJ, and first-generation immigrant from Mexico who is passionate about creating diverse teams. When interviewing people for jobs at Google, he says: “I draw on my experience as a first-generation immigrant to help understand how different life experiences shape a candidate’s story.” #HispanicHeritageMonth

2016-10-10.caption: This week's beautiful #MySuperG by @jessillustrates has us in the mood for some fall leaf-peeping. 🍂 Tag yours and we’ll continue to share our favorites each week.

2016-10-11.caption: This golden retriever named Google (!) taught us a lot about pet photography at a #GooglePhotos workshop in our São Paulo office. It’s safe to say we’ve found our spirit animal. 🐶

2016-10-12.caption: Meet Lucy. Born in Peru and raised in Athens, GA, she’s now a Googler working to level the playing field for communities that have unequal access to technology and economic opportunity. Lucy is also an active member of the NYC chapter of HOLA, our Hispanic Googlers Network, where she’s worked on efforts including a workshop for Latina small business owners and a tech immersion day for K-12 students. #HispanicHeritageMonth

2016-10-13.caption: Meet Dasha. She led planning for this year’s HOLA Leadership Summit in Washington, D.C. (bringing together more than 50 HOLA Googlers from across the world). She says her HOLA chapter in Chicago reminds her of her Ecuadorian family growing up: “Whether having dinner with another member's parents, or helping plan a quinceañera dance for a member’s daughter, our ties go beyond the walls of the office." #HispanicHeritageMonth

2016-10-14.caption: Nothing like some nougat to celebrate #NationalDessertDay. #AndroidAdventures

Meet Brendan and Olga, two leaders of HOLA, the Hispanic Googlers Network. As first-generation Americans whose families come from Hong Kong and Colombia, respectively, this dynamic duo teams up to help foster an inclusive culture for Hispanics, Latinos and their allies at Google. They say: "Google is more than place to work, it's a familia committed to advancing our community through education, technology and civic participation." #HispanicHeritageMonth

2016-10-17.caption: This week’s #MySuperG from @eyecandyberlin is giving us some sparkling new ideas. 💡✨

2016-10-18.caption: We're a dog-friendly company. Visit any Google office and you're likely to meet a #Doogler or two. We want to introduce some of them — starting with El Chupacabra (nickname: Chuppie). Chuppie spends his days in our San Francisco office and loves giving high fives. 🐶

2016-10-20.caption: We're at the Grace Hopper Celebration of Women in Computing and our booth is buzzing. If you're at #GHC16, join us there to chat about all things Google and #womenintech!

📷: @alliemtaylor

2015-07-07.caption: Hi, I'm Stas (@stas.boss), and I'm taking over the @Google Instagram for the day! A little about me: I’m a Googler on the Chromecast team in Dublin. I'm originally from Vladivostok, Russia but over the last 10 years, I've lived in South Korea, Poland and of course, Ireland. #GooglerTakeover

I’m based in Google’s Dublin, Ireland office. This is our headquarters for Europe, Middle East and Africa—Googlers here come from 65 countries and speak 45 languages! This cool staircase is my gym in the morning ;-) - Stas  #GooglerTakeover
I work on the Chromecast team supporting our retail partners in Europe, which means I talk to companies like Amazon or Tesco about anything Chromecast-related. - Stas #GooglerTakeover

Once my work is done, I'm off with my Googler friends to the seaside. We all started together at Google Poland but have since moved to different parts of the company across the world. Thanks for following along, and stay tuned for the next #GooglerTakeover! - Stas

2014-11-12.caption: Hi, I’m Omid, and I’m taking over the @Google feed for a day. A little about me: I’m Iranian—born in Germany—and I’ve been at Google for 5 years. I’m currently on the Google for Work team. I usually ‘gram as @omidscheybani, but today you can follow my posts on #GooglerTakeover
Usually I schedule a proper room for meetings, but my colleague Alexandrina's desk is so nicely decorated that we always meet at her desk -OS #GooglerTakeover
Some days I meet my colleagues for lunch, and other times we get together to work out. Kickboxing is our class of choice. -OS #GooglerTakeover

2014-11-13.caption: Google has lots of outdoor spaces—great for finishing up on emails on a nice afternoon. Thanks for following along today and stay tuned for the next #GooglerTakeover. Time for me to sign off! -@omidscheybani

2014-10-03.caption: We partnered with Guillermo del Toro and Legendary Entertainment to spook up our @YouTube Spaces in LA, Tokyo, London and NYC. Creators can use the sets throughout October to film their own horror shorts, so next time you're on YouTube, keep one eye open—you never know what might be lurking.

2014-10-07.caption: Our office in Haifa, Israel was designed with the city in mind—its neighborhoods, its port, and of course, the sea. In fact, Googlers in Haifa have to walk (or bike) all of 200 meters from the office to reach the beach. #TourTuesday

2014-10-15.caption: The Googleplex got a little bit sweeter today! To mark the launch of Android 5.0, Lollipop, we unveiled a new Android statue, a tradition that dates back to the launch of Android 1.5, Cupcake.

2014-10-21.caption: Navigate the Not-so-Straits of Malacca in our Kuala Lumpur office. This curvy corridor is an homage to Malacca's Jonker Walk, a market and haven for antique hunters. The birdcage is a nod to a practice in Baba Nyonya, or Malay-Chinese, homes that keep songbirds at the home entrance to greet visitors. #TourTuesday Photo by @crazymalaysian

2014-09-27.caption: Today our cake has 16 candles (plus one to grow on) #OkGoogle

2014-09-29.caption: It's Monday. It's also #NationalCoffeeDay. Coincidence? We think not.

2014-09-30.caption: Opa! Time for another #TourTuesday. This time, take a peek at our Athens office. It's no Parthenon, but it'll do.

2014-08-01.caption: There’s no shortage of amazing sights to explore in India, but, well, they’re in India. Now you can explore 70+ of the country’s historical wonders no matter where you are with #StreetView in @googlemaps g.co/go/indiawonders

2014-08-04.caption: For the artists on the doodle team, a project like today's tribute to John Venn (of diagram fame) is an opportunity to work whimsical details into one unified concept. Make your own diagram with @duttonart's intricate drawings on google.com today.

2014-08-05.caption: Our offices aren’t usually this glamorous, but in a city as stylish as Paris we can make an exception. At Google Paris, this “ballroom” combines a modern spirit with French flair in a renovated townhouse on the rue de Londres. #TourTuesday

2014-08-06.caption: We have liftoff! Take an interplanetary tour of Mars and the Moon in #GoogleMaps. #regram @googlemaps

2014-08-07.caption: Star-Lord @prattprattpratt visited our New York office last week. While there, he took a break from talking about his new movie #GuardiansoftheGalaxy to hone his hero skills fighting Blinky, Clyde and other ghosts in a game of Pac-Man.

2014-08-11.caption: We spent our morning playing with Cardboard, a virtual reality headset you can #DIY with a few simple materials and an Android phone. Grab a box from the garage and learn how to build yours: g.co/go/BuildCardboard

2014-08-12.caption: The Union Jack covers the walls of our newest London office. Other British bits and bobs in our U.K. locations include red telephone boxes for private calls, bowler hat lightshades and lounge areas decked out like famous London parks. Cheers! #tourtuesday

2014-08-14.caption: Earlier this summer, interns and our Google Women Engineers (GWE) group came together for two days of discussions, networking and fun at the We Are GWE Summit to support our community of women engineers. Learn more about our efforts to support women in technology: google.com/diversity/women #tbt

2014-08-19.caption: Googlers and Godzilla coexist peacefully (for the most part) in our Tokyo office, our first to open outside the U.S. The office is a perfect example of Japan’s blend of tradition and technology: it houses a digital koi pond and conference rooms that resemble "ryokans," or traditional Japanese inns. じゃあね! #TourTuesday

2014-08-21.caption: Sister Rosemarie DeLoro has been teaching for 60+ years, but never using technology. Then her school, Fontbonne Hall Academy in Brooklyn, N.Y., started using #GoogleClassroom, a new tool that helps teachers create and collect assignments paperlessly. Now, Sister DeLoro is teaching her fellow educators how to include computers in their curricula. Learn more at classroom.google.com

2014-08-26.caption: No tour of Google would be complete without stopping to pet one of our visiting dogs, like Pepper here. We have a dog-friendly workplace, so Googlers often bring their best friends in with them. See more Google dogs at g.co/go/dogdays. #NationalDogDay #TourTuesday

2014-09-01.caption: Summer on the #StreetView beaches of France lasts forever. Explore clear waters and blue skies in @GoogleMaps: http://g.co/go/svfrance

2014-07-08.caption: Seven-year-old Xochi Barricklow jumps to activate her handmade stomp rocket during @makemagazine's #MakerCamp launch in Sebastopol, CA on Monday. Young adventurers can find more camp projects at google.com/+MAKE.

2014-07-11.caption: It's no #TourdeFrance, but hundreds of "gBikes" make the rounds of our Mountain View campus every day. It's a healthy, environmental way to travel between meetings, to lunch and beyond.

2014-07-13.caption: That's a wrap! Over the past 32 days our first ever #WorldCup Trends Hub has showcased what the world was curious about during the tournament. We've watched 109+ hours of football, saw 2+ billion World Cup searches and spent 250+ hours designing and sharing 1000+ Search trends. See what the world was searching for at google.com/worldcup

2014-07-14.caption: We hold Doodle4Google competitions around the world. Our latest kicked off in the Philippines last week—check google.com.ph/doodle4google for more details.

2014-07-15.caption: School's out for summer—which means that our campuses are bustling with interns. More than 3,000 interns will spend the next few months working on everything from software engineering to people operations.

2014-07-17.caption: It's the end of the "I owe you" note. You can now send and request money via the Google Wallet App or Gmail—it's as simple as sending an email attachment. Find out more at google.com/wallet

2014-07-19.caption: Leave that double-decker and your Oyster card behind, and explore new 3D views of London in @GoogleMaps on desktop. g.co/go/london3D

2014-07-20.caption: OK Google, where can I get ice cream? Hope your #nationalicecreamday is out of this world!

2014-07-22.caption: Googlers packed the room and lined up around the block to welcome former U.S. Secretary of State Hillary Clinton to our Mountain View HQ. Watch her talk with Eric Schmidt: g.co/go/hillaryatgoogle

2014-07-24.caption: Happy 1st birthday, #Chromecast! Since Chromecast launched a year ago, people have hit the cast button 400M+ times to watch their favorite sports, music, movies and more on the biggest screen in their house. #HBDChromecast

2014-07-29.caption: Earlier this month we opened a new office space in a world capital. Can you guess which city? (Hint: there's a clue right here in the photo.) #TourTuesday

2014-06-13.caption: Every year thousands of Googlers worldwide give back to their communities during GoogleServe. Projects this year included greening local schools and parks, volunteering at animal shelters and senior centers and helping small businesses get started on the web.

2014-06-14.caption: They teach you how to ride your first bike, sneak you the last cookie when no one’s looking, and make sure there are no monsters under your bed. What can we say? Dads make the world go round. #HappyFathersDay (#regram from @googleglass)

2014-06-16.caption: Habitat destruction has led to just 1,600 pandas remaining in the world, and French sculptor Paulo Grangeon has come up with an unusual way to raise awareness of the species’ precarious position. He designed 1,600 papier-mâché pandas, and they’re now “on tour” in Hong Kong to promote conservation. We’ve captured some photos of the paper pandas in @GoogleMaps #StreetView.

Happy first birthday #ProjectLoon! This past year we’ve been working on getting our balloons to fly farther and last longer—all with the goal of bringing reliable Internet to people in remote places. We’ve learned at lot so far, though there’s more to be done. Up, up and away!

2014-06-19.caption: Google New York is ready for #Pride! More than 35 Google offices around the world are celebrating Pride this month (and throughout 2014), standing in support of the LGBT community everywhere.

2014-06-21.caption: This week we launched #MadewithCode to inspire more girls to code. Check it out at www.madewithcode.com

2014-06-22.caption: Today we celebrated #GoSkateboardingDay and the #SummerSolstice. Hello, summer!

2014-06-25.caption: Lights, camera... action! Google I/O 2014 starts tomorrow at 9 am PDT. Learn more and tune in at google.com/io #io14

2014-06-29.caption: Happy #pride! More than 1,000 Googlers marched in San Francisco's parade today, and more participated in other celebrations worldwide this month. #proudtoplay

2014-07-02.caption: Today Googlers in Mountain View channeled their inner cowboys at a BBQ lunch to celebrate the coming Independence Day holiday. Yeehaw!

2014-07-04.caption: Doodler Betsy Bauer combined two of her greatest influences—marching band and hand-drawn animation—to create today’s Independence Day video doodle for our U.S. homepage. Watch it on google.com/doodles

2014-05-19.caption: Today on our homepage we're celebrating the Rubik's Cube, which got us thinking—maybe we could do more squares? Hello Instagram!

2014-05-22.caption: Color us impressed. We had a great time hanging out with 50 talented young artists at today's #Doodle4Google awards ceremony. Congrats to all our winners!

2014-05-24.caption: You've come a long way, seniors. We're excited for what's next. We made a short video to congratulate the #classof2014 - check out "Grads" on the Google YouTube channel.

2014-05-27.caption: Doodler Matt Cruickshank drew many versions of his Rachel Carson doodle in order to get to the one that appears on google.com today. One of his earliest sketches showed her alone on a sea cliff, but later he decided to focus on the wildlife that she sought to protect.

2014-05-28.caption: Imagine a future where you get in your car and just press go. Here's an early peek at the next stop on the road to a self-driving car.

2014-05-31.caption: Though we usually stick to primary colors, we can make an exception for Orange is the New Black. Googlers lined up to welcome the cast to campus today.

2014-06-05.caption: Every #WorldCup, Brazilians hit the streets with paint and brush to show off their love of football. Tour the painted streets in #StreetView starting today: http://g.co/brazilpaintedstreets

2014-06-07.caption: Nothing says #TGIF like an office-wide sugar high. Happy #NationalDonutDay!

2014-06-08.caption: To the Galapagos and beyond! Spend #WorldOceansDay exploring underwater scenes with @GoogleMaps #StreetView. maps.google.com/oceans

2014-06-09.caption: Congrats to this year's #Doodle4Google winner Audrey Zhang! She spent a day with the Doodle team to animate her winning illustration—see it on www.google.com today

2014-06-10.caption: To launch our #StreetArtProject, artists in Paris and Buenos Aires collaborated on a virtual art wall. Immerse yourself in a world of colorful street art at g.co/streetart

2014-06-12.caption: Today’s the day! Gear up for kickoff by exploring all 12 #WorldCup stadiums—like Arena Pernambuco here—in @GoogleMaps

2018-01-22.caption: Tomorrow’s leaders are sitting in today’s classrooms. We're taking big steps to help prepare them for the digital future as we roll out six new augmented reality and virtual reality applications developed in partnership with Pearson.

2018-01-30.caption: After winning the 15th annual #ImagineCup last summer, Team X.Glu participated in a mentoring session with Microsoft CEO Satya Nadella to discuss their project: a device that makes diabetes management easier and more accessible.

2018-02-03.caption:
We partnered with six NFL superstars, including @LarryFitzgerald, to share powerful stories of how they are working to make an impact in their local communities. The Larry Fitzgerald First Down Fund was established to help kids and their families by funding positive activities for kids during the summer and throughout the year, supporting kids and families in crisis, and supporting health-related organizations that work with families.

Learn more by clicking the link in our bio.

2018-02-07.caption: The future of artificial intelligence is huge. To make sure we can grasp it, Microsoft researchers are developing a new class of machine learning tools to embed #AI onto breadcrumb-sized computer processors. 📷: Dan DeLong

2018-02-20.caption:
When Hurricane Maria struck Puerto Rico, Microsoft employees stepped in to map the island to aid recovery efforts. 
Learn more about our philanthropic work by clicking the link in our bio.

2018-02-23.caption: Behind the scenes at Bloom: Open Space, a new mixed reality art installation from Brian Eno and Peter Chilvers that blurs the lines between physical and virtual worlds.

"Technology sees no race. It sees no religion. It sees no socio-economic background. It's there for everyone, and I think that's a staple of inclusion." As part of our Create Change Program, we teamed up with NFL superstar @LarryFitzgerald in his efforts to bridge the digital divide and give more students access to opportunity-boosting technology. Learn more about the cause by clicking the link in our bio.

2018-02-27.caption: Toni Townes-Whitley, our CVP of Industry, spoke at last week’s “Meet Our Leaders” event with Microsoft employees. She encouraged employees to be curious—to stop and reflect on where we are; to be aware of our own views and biases.

2018-03-01.caption: Project Premonition aims to detect pathogens before they cause outbreaks. Microsoft researchers created this robotic mosquito trap which consists of 64 smart cells and captures interesting mosquitoes in milliseconds.

2018-03-06.caption:
It’s not about what technology can do. It’s about what you can do with it. 
We’re celebrating those who use AI to drive innovation.

2018-03-12.caption: In just one year, Microsoft Teams has become the go-to collaboration tool for Macy's, NASCAR, General Motors and more. Today, we’re saying congrats to the team behind Teams with a cupcake (or two).

2018-03-15.caption: We collaborated with UW's Molecular Information Systems Lab to break the world record for the amount of digital data successfully stored and retrieved in DNA molecules. Here's our digital microfluidics automated DNA data-storage prototype. (Say that five times fast 😉🤓)

2017-11-16.caption: @YuwaIndia is using soccer and education to help girls in India become voices of change in their communities and beyond. Learn how Microsoft Edge helped bring a 360° story the girls created themselves to life by clicking the link in our bio.

2017-11-20.caption: At Deschutes Brewery in Oregon, craft beer is brewed with data and has distinct notes of cloud. 🍺 Pony up to the link in our bio to watch the latest episode of Work Reworked and learn more.

2017-11-27.caption: Yuwa School was founded in 2009 as a way to empower girls in rural India through sport and education. Since then, students have gone on to tell their stories all around India and the world, speaking at TEDx, universities, professional conferences, awards events and the FIFA Women’s World Cup. Learn more about Yuwa School by clicking the link in our bio.

2017-11-29.caption: 18 new buildings. 6.7 million square feet of workspace. A transportation infrastructure overhaul. New sports fields and more. Learn all about the future of our Redmond campus by clicking the link in our bio. #MicrosoftLife

2017-12-01.caption: “For them to be part of a community where they feel like they have worth is extremely powerful—it’s life-changing.” - Franz Gastler on the impact of his nonprofit, #Yuwa. Learn about our partnership with Franz and Yuwa by clicking the link in our bio.

2017-12-05.caption: The new Microsoft Silicon Valley campus will be the first tech campus with Net-Zero Water certification. Learn more about Microsoft's smartest, greenest office yet by clicking the link in our bio.

2017-12-12.caption: The Seattle @Seahawks' DeShawn Shead loves a challenge. Data and sports science helped him face recovery rehab head on. Learn more by clicking the link in our bio.

2017-12-14.caption: Microsoft Stores are selecting and granting wishes that make an impact. Learn how you can submit a holiday wish to the #MicrosoftWishMachine by clicking the link in our bio.

2017-12-22.caption:
Around the world, Microsoft is committed to creating technology that empowers people to achieve more. Swipe to see some of our most popular feature stories from 2017, including:
• @detroitwallpaper co-founders Andi Kubacki and Josh Young,
• The launch of CEO Satya Nadella’s #HitRefresh book,
• A partnership with L V Prasad Eye Institute to create Connected Eyes,
• Non-profit @yuwaindia's partnership with Microsoft Edge to help young girls in rural India,
• Our vision for what's next in education, illustrated by @heyheysu, and
• The launch of the world's most powerful console, #XboxOneX.

2018-01-17.caption: KC Lemson is the social motivator and mastermind behind Microsoft’s #NinjaCat meme. Click the link in our bio to see how she brings passion and fun to the company she loves.

2018-01-18.caption: The #FutureComputed explores the role of AI in society, like how it enables researchers to conduct pathogen detection in the environment before an outbreak even begins. Learn more by clicking the link in our bio.

2017-09-25.caption: Greetings from Orlando. We're here with 23,000 technology and business leaders for #msignite and #msenvision. @realmadrid, @pgatour, @fruitoftheloom, and @marcjacobs are just a few of the brands here showcasing their stories of #digitaltransformation.

2017-09-26.caption:
Behind the scenes at @cbsthismorning with @gayleking. Microsoft CEO Satya Nadella was on the show today, talking about his new book, #HitRefresh. 
If you missed it, you can catch it on CBS This Morning's YouTube channel.

2017-09-27.caption: #behindthescenes: Microsoft CEO Satya Nadella joins Richard Quest on @cnni at 4PM ET today. Tune in to hear them talk leadership, the tech industry, and Satya's new book #HitRefresh 📺

2017-09-29.caption: It’s been an exciting week with the launch of our CEO Satya Nadella's book #HitRefresh. Learn more about the book by clicking the link in our bio.

2017-10-05.caption: Microsoft employees Edaena Salinas and Heather Shapiro are passionate about the advancement of women in technology. They're two of our employee ambassadors attending #GHC17 in Orlando this week. Learn more about them via the link in our bio, and be sure to stop by our booth if you're at the Grace Hopper Celebration.

2017-10-06.caption: SEQUENCE Collection is empowering young artists and disrupting the cycle of violence in El Salvador. We're supporting their mission by building 3D and AR digital tools that allow the artists to express their passions and positive energy to the world. Learn more by clicking the link in our bio.

2017-10-09.caption: The designers behind the record-breaking Xbox One X share the intensive planning, challenges and pain-staking precision that went into the creation of Microsoft's most compact and powerful console yet. Read their full story by clicking the link in our bio.

2017-10-12.caption:
On a recent visit to Lord's Cricket Ground, CEO Satya Nadella thinks back to his first brush with cricket on the pitches of Hyderabad, India.
He recounts leadership lessons learned from the sport in his new book, #HitRefresh. Learn more about the book through the link in our bio.

2017-10-13.caption: We can't stop looking up. 🌲 Our new collaboration workspaces are nestled in the woods of our 500-acre Redmond, WA campus. Designed by @nelsontreehouse with a scientific eye, these spaces benefit our employees through the powerful impact that nature has on creativity, focus and happiness. #MicrosoftLife

2017-10-21.caption: Microsoft CEO Satya Nadella asks Coach @petecarroll how the @seahawks #hitrefresh every week - and every season. 🏈

2017-10-25.caption: We're partnering with the Boys & Girls Clubs of America to encourage kids to explore the world of computer science and seize the career opportunities of the future. Learn more by clicking the link in our bio.

2017-11-07.caption: “We built #XboxOneX to give game creators the most powerful platform to bring their visions to life and to give gamers the best console to play the games of the past, present, and future." Learn about the intensive planning, pure precision, and meticulous detail that went into building Xbox One X, the world's most powerful console, via the link in our bio.

2017-08-16.caption: A letter from a middle school student in Nevada reminded us about the power of his favorite subject. As everyone’s heading back to school, we’re celebrating the sharp students and dedicated teachers whose passions for learning empower us all. Click the link in our bio to watch the full video.

2017-08-21.caption: These extraordinary women are changing the world with their groundbreaking inventions. See their ideas unfold through the #MakeWhatsNext Patent Program. Learn more by clicking the link in our bio.

2017-08-22.caption: She made a simple app that detects preventable diseases before things get complicated. Dr. Meghana Kambham is one of the extraordinary women turning ideas into inventions with the support of our #MakeWhatsNext Patent Program.

2017-08-23.caption: A student team wanted a world without bullying, so they built one - in virtual reality. Soon, they'll make the real world a better place too, with support from our #MakeWhatsNext Patent Program. Learn more by clicking the link in our bio.

2017-08-24.caption: An all-women team invented a device to convert text to braille for blind readers in real-time. Their extraordinary idea is one step closer to becoming a reality. We're proud to support Team Tactile through our #MakeWhatsNext Patent Program. Learn more by clicking the link in our bio.

2017-08-25.caption: A generation without sickle cell disease could start with their detection app. These female technologists are making a real difference with their ideas, and the support of our #MakeWhatsNext Patent Program. Learn more by clicking the link in our bio.
Women hold only 7.5% of patents. The women of the #MakeWhatsNext Patent Program are shifting the balance - and changing the world. Learn more by clicking the link in our bio.

2017-09-09.caption: Welcome to our home, @CreateCultivate. We're happy to host your event that inspires and empowers so many women. Check out our Instagram story and follow #createcultivatesea to see the amazing things happening on Microsoft campus today.
It's been great welcoming @CreateCultivate to Microsoft campus today. This conference empowers and inspires entrepreneurial women, a mission we wholeheartedly support. #CreateCultivateSEA

2017-09-18.caption: @FastCompany gives us the cover treatment. Read their in-depth look at our journey under CEO Satya Nadella, and read an exclusive excerpt from his new book, #HitRefresh. Link in bio.

2017-09-22.caption: We partnered with Facebook and Telxius to launch Marea, a 160-terabit cable that joins North America and Spain. It will give us enough capacity to stream 71 million HD videos at once. Learn more at the link in our bio. 🌎🌊

2017-06-26.caption: Today, Microsoft employees marched at #SeattlePride. It was one of 29 cities in which we are participating in #pride celebrations around the world. For almost three decades, Microsoft has been at the forefront of supporting #LGBT employees and continue to advocate for a more inclusive world.

2017-06-27.caption: Taking a look in the rear view mirror at the @racesonoma #TSM350. From shaving seconds off pit stops, to enabling even more precision among race officials, Microsoft technology powers the most critical moments of @NASCAR races. Tools like the Surface Dial and the race management app, built on Windows 10 and the Microsoft Cloud, make the racing experience faster, safer and more efficient - every lap of the way.

2017-07-12.caption:
One of the many partners we met at #MSInspire was Dmytro Kostyk, CEO of @Kodisoft. Kodisoft is a Microsoft Partner that makes this amazing interactive table for restaurants. This Windows IoT powered device has a 4K waterproof screen that's spillproof and super durable. Always impressed with the people who make things with the things that we make.

See more from Microsoft Inspire on our Instagram story.

2017-07-13.caption: Hugging loved ones. Opening doors. Tying shoelaces. Easton LaChappelle is focused on providing people with affordable robotic limbs and access to simple moments like these. Though technology is behind each and every aspect of his story, the heart of his work lies with the people whose lives it will change. Get the full story at the link in our bio.

2017-07-18.caption: Nine-year-old Momo excels in academics and athletics, from poetry improvisation to horseback riding. She was also born without a right forearm and hand, and has used a basic prosthetic with limited movement since the age of 4. Now, Momo is the first recipient of an artificial limb technology developed by 21-year-old robotics engineer Easton LaChappelle that could impact millions of people all over the world.

2017-07-19.caption: The @empowermentplan is a different kind of employer. They hire homeless parents and teach valuable trade skills, so employees can build stable futures for their families. Every day at 3PM, seamstresses stop sewing and start taking classes. From leadership to computer literacy, it’s empowering them to both imagine a brighter future and make it a reality. See how tech is helping them take the next step at the link in our bio.

2017-07-21.caption: “I don’t know of any job where there’s not a computer involved in some kind of way, shape or form.“ That's why Shy Averett, the Community Development Specialist at Greater Detroit’s @MicrosoftStore, is intent on helping people everywhere gain digital literacy skills. Her team recently hosted a 10-week technology workshop series for employees of The @EmpowermentPlan, a local nonprofit that employs formerly homeless single mothers. From PowerPoint presentations to resume building, the workshops were designed to arm the women with the tech skills necessary to pursue their dreams. Learn more at the link in our bio.

2017-07-24.caption: “Today has changed my life.” When nine-year-old Momo received a fully-functional robotic arm, built by Easton LaChappelle, she spent the day practicing different hand positions – from high-fives and fist bumps, to handshakes and hearts. Moving forward, Momo's input will be instrumental in helping Easton engineer artificial limbs at costs radically lower than traditional prosthetics. Get the full story at the link in our bio.

2017-07-27.caption: For 15 years, Imagine Cup has invited students around the world to bring their biggest, boldest ideas to life. This year, Team X.GLU from the Czech Republic won the $200K prize package with their project that helps people with diabetes better cope with the disease's symptoms. Congratulations to our new Imagine Cup winners, and to all 54 student teams who participated. 🏆🏅Learn more by clicking the link in our bio.

2017-07-28.caption: The @EmpowermentPlan makes more than coats. They're making dreams come true for formerly-homeless employees like Jessica West. Jessica has already been promoted from seamstress to floor manager, and hopes to keep moving up at The Empowerment Plan. She's pursuing her bachelor’s degree for leadership and organizational studies, and recently participated in a tech training workshop hosted by the Greater Detroit @MicrosoftStore that made her think not just about tech, but her own goals as well. "I want to grow to the top and blossom. And now I'm able to plant my own seeds." Learn more about Jessica, The Empowerment Plan, and the recent tech workshop at the link in our bio.

2017-08-02.caption: “My goal at every show is to connect.” We worked with DJ and producer @AlisonWonderland to help her do just that by taking her live visual experience to the next level ahead of her upcoming worldwide tour. The end result is a custom Surface-powered tour kit that can be controlled from the stage. The compact set-up works with Kinect in real time to tailor visuals to any venue, and insert her human element and distinct style into each performance.

2017-08-04.caption: Girls Make Games: it's a summer camp for making video games. And with the help of these young creators, it'll soon be an industry-wide statement of fact. Click the link in our bio to learn more.

2017-04-21.caption: Every single one of Summer Winrotte's students uses a @Surface and #OneNote to track assignments and complete coursework. See how else her paperless classroom is preparing students for the future by clicking the link in our bio.

2017-05-02.caption: Our bags are packed and we're ready for today's #MicrosoftEDU event. Watch live at 9:30AM ET by clicking the link in our bio, and stay tuned for updates all day on our Instagram Story.
Thanks so much for joining us today as we shared our vision for what's next in education. And a big thank you to @heyheysu for live illustrating our exciting day. #MicrosoftEDU

2017-05-12.caption: Emma Lawton hasn't been able to write her own name for years. The graphic designer was diagnosed with Parkinson's disease in 2013, destroying her ability to draw letters and lines. Those devastating losses inspired Microsoft researcher Haiyan Zhang to start a new project. Haiyan spent months studying Parkinson’s disease while building and testing prototypes that would temporarily "short-circuit" Emma's hand tremors, allowing her to write again. Today the "Emma Watch" has given the designer back what she has always considered a basic human right: the ability to write her own name. "It’s not going to be perfect. But, my God, it’s better.” Learn more about Emma, Haiyan and the future of the project by clicking the link in our bio.

2017-05-22.caption: Follow along with our #MicrosoftEvent in Shanghai starting at 11AM GMT Tuesday, May 23 by clicking the link in our bio.

2017-05-30.caption: When Andi Kubacki and Josh Young hit a professional wall, they decided to paper it. The duo concocted a business idea in their basement, and now they’ve brought that idea to the big time. Co-founders of @detroitwallpaper, they’ve embraced personalization, tech savvy and bold design to offer customizable wallcoverings to clients around the world. Get the full story at the link in our bio.

2017-05-31.caption: Water. Food. Medicine. Shelter. Those are tangible – and obvious – ways aid organizations around the world help people in struggling areas to survive. But unexpected tools can help nonprofits make a huge impact, too. Data visualization is helping groups like Pact feed kids, grow healthy trees and survive cutbacks. Read how at the link in our bio.

2017-06-01.caption: When she was stung by two bees at the age of four, @mikailasbees turned her fear into a passion project. That’s where Me & the Bees Lemonade was born. Armed with her great-grandmother’s recipe and determination, Mikaila built a lemonade business centered around keeping bees healthy and productive. With Microsoft technology helping to power the business behind the scenes, Mikaila is free to "be fearless, believe in the impossible, and dream like a kid."

2017-06-02.caption: The galaxy. Lipstick. Oil spills. Inkblots. Pill bottles. Not your typical wallpaper patterns. But that’s how Josh Young and Andi Kubacki like it. The nontraditional design duo finds inspiration in the weirdest places, and then transforms those ideas into customizable wallpapers. Microsoft tech helps them translate each stroke of creative genius into real, tangible wallcoverings that can be found in homes, businesses and hotels around the world. Find out more at the link in our bio.

2017-06-07.caption: “If we’re not having fun, there’s something wrong.” @detroitwallpaper co-founder Andi Kubacki lives by that motto, because he and his business partner Josh Young know that good design is just as important as good company. That’s why their bespoke wallpaper company has been so successful. They pair daring designs with business know-how, and a constant sense of humor. We're glad Microsoft technology plays a part in their success. Check out our full story on Detroit Wallpaper via the link in our bio.

2017-06-19.caption: Farhad Agajan was forced to flee his home in Afghanistan when he was only 8 years old. His family had vanished and he had nowhere to turn. Over the next decade he journeyed through Pakistan, Iran and Turkey before finally building a new life in Greece. Today, Farhad has used his own experience as a refugee to help others, working as a field officer with @mercycorps, while also finishing high school and studying computer programming. Microsoft is working to bring the right technology and tools to more people like Farhad and other aid organizations like Mercy Corps around the world. Read more about our commitment via the link in our bio.

2017-06-24.caption:
Buckle up...we're in Sonoma for the #TSM350 with @NASCAR. 🏎
Engines are revving, but before drivers can put the pedal to the metal, cars must go through mobile inspection. 🏁
The power of @Windows 10 and the Microsoft Cloud help cars spend more time on the track and less time in the garage. ☁️
Get a closer look at the whole day - and this weekend - on our Instagram Story.

2017-03-09.caption: When we encourage girls to pursue #STEM, we double our potential for innovation. #MakeWhatsNext #IWD2017

A tweeting dress. A pollution-detecting makeup concept. The retro-futuristic farm of 2050. See what else Microsoft Research designer and "fusionist" Asta Roseway is up to by clicking the link in our bio.

2017-03-10.caption: The Microsoft Archives lies tucked away in a nondescript building on campus. This treasure trove of throwbacks takes us down memory lane to revisit Microsoft's greatest hits and some old friends we've met along the way.
She could be the one to crack the code or find the cure. Click the link in our bio to find out how girls can change the world by staying in #STEM. #MakeWhatsNext

2017-03-14.caption: It's not every day that two great athletes can team up for an intensive training session, but that's what professional futbol player Daniele Bruno and @SpecialOlympics snowshoer Anton Grotz did. They started at the soccer pitch working on ball handling skills, agility and power shooting, then Anton brought Daniele to his family farm for intensive speed training with snowshoes. "He's like me," says Daniele of Anton, "He never gives up." This year, Microsoft is helping empower #SpecialOlympics athletes around the world as the Official Technology Partner of the Games. Learn why #WeAreMore when we work together by clicking the link in our bio.

2017-03-17.caption:
Dedication to sport is only part of the story. As the Official Technology Partner of the #SpecialOlympics we're joining six people on their journey of discovery as they connect through sport and shared passions, illustrating #WeAreMore through inclusion, collaboration and creativity.
Meet the athletes and their mentors by clicking the link in our bio and keep an eye on our Instagram Stories for updates from Austria.

2017-03-24.caption: Every student should have access to tech education. James Burke and Jason Ewert are two teachers dedicated to making that vision a reality. Watch how they're introducing their students to #STEM lessons with plastic cups, paper plates, a little technology, and a lot of creativity.

2017-03-31.caption: We hosted #MakeWhatsNext workshops in Microsoft Stores around the country in partnership with @NatGeo. See what the girls learned and meet the female #STEM experts who taught the courses by clicking the link in our bio.

2017-04-03.caption: We're proud to be the Official Technology Partner of @SpecialOlympics. We had a great time cheering for all the #Austria2017 athletes last week, who always remind us that #WeAreMore when we work together.

2017-04-04.caption: Fifty-five million people in India live with visual impairments. Eighty percent of them could benefit from simple, everyday procedures. Our team in India partnered with L V Prasad Eye Institute to create Connected Eyes, a cloud-based, machine-learning research project that harnesses artificial intelligence to correct vision. The project was honored as one of @fastcompany's 2017 World Changing Ideas.

2017-04-12.caption: Join us May 2 for a livestream to learn what’s next from Microsoft. Add it to your calendar via link in bio. #MicrosoftEDU

2017-04-20.caption: Both of Heather Dowdy's parents lost their hearing as toddlers. She learned sign language starting at just six months old. Today, she's dedicated her career to building products for people of all abilities as a program manager on our Web Accessibility team. Together, Heather and her teammates develop strategies to make the internet accessible for everyone. See what else Heather is up to by clicking the link in our bio.

2017-01-24.caption: A @Surface tethered to his camera gives professional photographer Joshua Lawrence the freedom to unleash his creativity while he's on set. Whether @jlstudios is shooting athletes, models or home interiors, his high-tech setup offers the flexibility to allow him to to light, arrange and direct the ideal shot in real time. Because Joshua doesn’t just capture the perfect moment—he creates it. Learn more at the link in our bio.

2017-01-25.caption: A multimillion dollar kitchen. An expert fitness routine. An on-location hotel shoot.
